name: vscode-ps-rule
description: Validate infrastructure as code (IaC) and DevOps repositories using PSRule.

PSRule.codeLens.ruleDocumentationLinks.markdownDescription: Enables Code Lens that displays links to rule documentation.

PSRule.codeLens.dependencyManagement.markdownDescription: Enables Code Lens that displays links to manage dependencies.

PSRule.documentation.path.description: The path to look for rule documentation. When not set, the path containing rules will be used.

PSRule.documentation.localePath.markdownDescription: The locale path to use for locating rule documentation. The VS Code locale will be used by default.

PSRule.documentation.customSnippetPath.markdownDescription: The path to a file containing a rule documentation snippet. When not set, built-in PSRule snippets will be used.

PSRule.documentation.snippet.markdownDescription: The name of a snippet to use when creating new rule documentation. By default, the built-in `Rule Doc` snippet will be used.

PSRule.execution.ruleExcluded.markdownDescription: Determines how to handle [excluded rules](https://aka.ms/ps-rule/options#executionruleexcluded). When set to `None`, PSRule will use the default (`Ignore`), unless set by [PSRule options](https://aka.ms/ps-rule/options#executionruleexcluded).
markdownEnumDescriptions: Excluded rules will not generate any notifications unless overridden.
Excluded rules will not generate any notifications.
Excluded rules will generate a warning.
Excluded rules will generate an error.

PSRule.execution.ruleSuppressed.markdownDescription: Determines how to handle [suppressed rules](https://aka.ms/ps-rule/options#executionrulesuppressed). When set to `None`, PSRule will use the default (`Warn`), unless set by [PSRule options](https://aka.ms/ps-rule/options#executionrulesuppressed).
markdownEnumDescriptions: Suppressed rules will generate a warning unless overridden.
Suppressed rules will not generate any notifications.
Suppressed rules will generate a warning.
Suppressed rules will generate an error.

PSRule.execution.unprocessedObject.markdownDescription: Determines how to report objects that are [not processed by any rule](https://aka.ms/ps-rule/options#executionunprocessedobject). When set to `None`, PSRule will use the default (`Warn`), unless set by [PSRule options](https://aka.ms/ps-rule/options#executionunprocessedobject).
markdownEnumDescriptions: Suppressed rules will generate a warning unless overridden.
Suppressed rules will not generate any notifications.
Suppressed rules will generate a warning.
Suppressed rules will generate an error.

PSRule.experimental.enabled.markdownDescription: Enables experimental features in the PSRule extension.

PSRule.lock.restore.markdownDescription: Determines if workspace modules will automatically be restored during activation. Modules can be restored manually using the `PSRule: Restore modules` command.

PSRule.notifications.showChannelUpgrade.markdownDescription: Determines if a notification to switch to the stable channel is shown on activation.

PSRule.notifications.showModuleRestore.markdownDescription: Determines if a notification to restore modules is shown on activation.

PSRule.notifications.showPowerShellExten.markdownDescription: Determines if a notification to install the PowerShell extension is shown on activation.

PSRule.options.path.markdownDescription: The path specifying a PSRule option file. When not set, the default `ps-rule.yaml` will be used from the current workspace.

PSRule.output.as.markdownDescription: Configures the output of analysis tasks, either summary or detailed.

PSRule.rule.baseline.markdownDescription: The name of the default baseline to use for executing rules. This setting can be overridden on individual PSRule tasks.

PSRule.trace.task.markdownDescription: Determines if verbose logging is enabled for task output.

inputPath.description: The path PSRule will look for input files. Defaults to workspace root.

baseline.description: The name of a PSRule baseline to use. Baselines can be used from modules or specified in a separate file. This option overrides the default baseline setting set for a workspace or user.

modules.description: The name of one or more modules to use.

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with PSRule
walkthroughs.description: Learn about and start using PSRule with Visual Studio Code.

steps.title: Configure an options file
steps.description:
The options file **ps-rule.yaml** is used to initialize a workspace and configure features of PSRule.
[Open an options file](command:PSRule.openOptionsFile)
[Create an options file](command:PSRule.createOptionsFile)
Tip: [Close the side bar for more space](command:workbench.action.closeSidebar)

steps.title: Configure settings
steps.description:
In addition to **ps-rule.yaml**, some settings that affect how PSRule runs within Visual Studio Code can be configured per user or per workspace.
[Configure settings](command:PSRule.configureSettings)
Tip: __You can sync some of these settings across devices.__

steps.title: Run analysis
steps.description:
Tasks can be used to run analysis on files within your current Visual Studio Code workspace.
[Show tasks](command:PSRule.showTasks)
Or you can run the [analysis](command:PSRule.runAnalysisTask) task directly from the command palette.

steps.title: Learn more
steps.description: Check out our [PSRule documentation](https://aka.ms/ps-rule) to learn more about features and customization.

scripts.zzz_vscode:prepublish: npm run -S esbuild-base -- --minify && dotnet publish ./src/PSRule.EditorServices/ --output server/
scripts.zzz_pack: npm run vscode:prepublish && npm run publish
scripts.build: npm run build:dotnet && npm run build:esbuild && npm run build:pack
scripts.package: npm run package:dotnet && npm run package:esbuild && npm run package:pack
scripts.package:pack: vsce package --dependencies --pre-release --no-git-tag-version --no-update-package-json --githubBranch main --out out/package/ --readme-path src/vscode-ps-rule/README.md --changelog-path docs/changelog.md --baseImagesUrl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/PSRule/refs/heads/main/
scripts.test: npm run build:dotnet && npm run build:esbuild && vscode-test
